description: The Vodka Cranberry is derived from the classic Cape Codder cocktail, consisting of vodka and cranberry juice. The name was derived from Cape Cod, Massachusetts, a peninsula and popular tourist destination located in the eastern United States, which is famous for growing cranberries.This drink was conceived in 1945 by the Ocean Spray cranberry grower's cooperative under the name "Red Devil" in Cape Cod, Massachusetts.
name: Vodka Cranberry
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp. Maple syrup or simple syrup

recipeInstructions.name: Prepare a highball glass with crushed ice.
recipeInstructions.text: Prepare a highball glass with crushed ice.

recipeInstructions.name: Add the vodka, cranberry juice, and syrup. Stir with a bar spoon.
recipeInstructions.text: Add the vodka, cranberry juice, and syrup. Stir with a bar spoon.

recipeInstructions.name: Squeeze the lime wedge and use it as a garnish.
